intro: Aegiphila humboldtii, commonly known as the Humboldt's aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, clustered in whorls along the stem, and bloom during the spring and early summer. Aegiphila humboldtii is adapted to grow in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in high-altitude environments.
